text: Osgar was a 10th-century Abbot of Abingdon in the English county of Berkshire (now Oxfordshire). Osgar was a cleric in minor orders who went with Saint Aethelwold from Glastonbury to Abingdon. He was eventually appointed Æthelwold's successor, probably in 964 and died in 984 (Kelly 2000). == References == *Kelly, S. E. 2000. Charters of Abingdon, part 1. Anglo-Saxon Charters 7. ==External links== * Category:Abbots of Abingdon Category:984 deaths Category:Year of birth unknown
title: Osgar
